messages.clickWord: Click on a word to change it

exampleContent.title: Click to Change Examples
exampleContent.description: Learn how to identify and correct errors by clicking on words to cycle through options
learningPoints: Read the sentence carefully to identify what needs to be changed
Click on words that seem incorrect or inappropriate
Consider grammar rules and sentence meaning
Look for context clues that indicate the correct choice
Check that your changes make the sentence logical and grammatically correct

sections.title: Grammar Correction
sections.description: Learn to identify and fix common grammar mistakes in sentences

examples.sentence: The dog are running in the park.
examples.explanation: Since 'dog' is singular, we need the singular verb 'is' instead of the plural 'are'.
examples.grammarRule: Subject-verb agreement: singular subjects take singular verbs

examples.explanation: 'She' is a singular pronoun, so it needs 'doesn't' (does not) rather than 'don't' (do not).
examples.grammarRule: Use 'doesn't' with singular subjects (he, she, it)

examples.explanation: 'Seen' requires a helping verb (have seen). For past tense without a helper, use 'saw'.
examples.grammarRule: Past tense vs. past participle usage

sections.title: Word Choice Correction
sections.description: Learn to select the most appropriate word for the context

examples.sentence: The weather is very cold today.
examples.explanation: If the context suggests summer or warm conditions, 'hot' would be more appropriate than 'cold'.

examples.sentence: She walked slow to the store.
examples.explanation: We need an adverb 'slowly' to describe how she walked, not the adjective 'slow'.

exercises.instruction: Click on the incorrect word to fix the grammar error.
exercises.sentence: The cats is sleeping on the couch.
exercises.explanation: Since 'cats' is plural, we need the plural verb 'are' instead of the singular 'is'.

exercises.instruction: Click on the word that needs to be changed to make the sentence correct.
exercises.sentence: She don't have any homework today.
exercises.explanation: 'She' is singular, so it should be 'doesn't' (does not) instead of 'don't' (do not).

exercises.instruction: Click on the word that should be changed to improve the sentence.
exercises.sentence: The dog run fast in the yard.
exercises.explanation: 'Dog' is singular, so it needs the singular verb 'runs' instead of 'run'.

exercises.instruction: Click on the word that needs to be corrected.
exercises.sentence: I seen that movie last week.
exercises.explanation: For past tense without a helping verb, use 'saw' instead of 'seen'. 'Seen' would need 'have' (I have seen).
